Message.Title: Falling apart everywhere!!..Florida Hispanics
Message.Msg: ST. PETERSBURG -- There are two million Hispanic voters in Florida. It's a constituency that has the power to shift a tight election, so both political parties have tried to sway the Hispanic vote their way. President Barack Obama has held a comfortable lead with Hispanics. But now there has been a significant shift in the polls. An exclusive Tampa Bay Times/Bay News 9 statewide poll shows many Hispanic voters dropping their support for Obama. Last month, 52 percent of Hispanic voters polled said they would vote for the president. That has now dropped to 44 percent. Romney picked up some ground among Hispanics, from 43 percent to 46 percent. And the number of undecided Hispanic voters has doubled from 5 to 10 percent.

Topic.Title: Romney supporters threaten "we won't create any jobs" if the President is re-elected!

Message.Msg: No smart business person will pass up the most profitable option because that profit is taxed too much. What a business ignorant comment. If you can PROFIT $1,000,000 off of hiring a new employee you will hire that employee regardless of whether or not you keep $650,000 or $600,000. It is stupid to think that employee won't get hired simply because an extra 5-10% of the profit will be taxed, and if that employee wasn't hired it must mean hiring said employee would not have been that profitable in the first place. Taxes never create negative profit. Also if all the "job creators" are all getting together and agreeing on how many employees they will all decide to hire, then that sounds a lot like socialism to me and we should get some new CEO's in there who really understand business.

Topic.Title: Romney supporters threaten "we won't create any jobs" if the President is re-elected!

Message.Msg: Look at the history of development and expansion in th USA. Our most prosperous years were when we had higher tax rates than we do now. Your silly assumptions about sky high taxes are ill conceived and untrue. Present tax rates could easily be raised on the top earners with no disincentive to investment. Romney even plans to increase taxes. He just chooses to do it by deceit and fees, closing "loopholes" . The bottom line is there will be no faster recovery without more revenue being brought in and both parties intend to get more from one segment of society or the other. Romney and Ryan plan to pass the costs on to individuals and states to cut federal costs with more unfunded mandates higher personal costs for medical care and reductions in social security benefits in the future. Romney and Ryan have also stated they do not expect to have a balanced budget in the next 8 years. Obama has been increasing jobs for 40 months, has cut medical costs, and preserved medicare and social security in the short term and with the slightest cooperation from the GOP could solve both of those problems. Businesses are reaping record profits and the wealthy are increasing their share of the take by unfair tax rates that benefit investment and ownership over labor short changing the middle class working man.

Topic.Title: Fox And Wastes Dick Morris Says Romney Will Win By 5

Message.Msg: #$%$ & you know it. (1) Farmers aren't about to "rest their fields" with current very high grain prices. As a matter of fact, they're bidding for tillable pasture land to put even marginal land into crop production. (2) On a per-capita basis, farmers have perhaps been the largest receivers of socialistic income/wealth redistributions since the New Deal. Far from being against socialism, they have been very aggressive in lobbying for and using the various socialistic Farm Programs. (3) To imply that, without gov involvement such as the gov enforced acreage restrictions we've had in the past, farmers will withhold production capacity in order to get prices up is silly. Individual farmers will produce while encouraging their neighbors to cut. Farmers aren't against socialism, they just prefer that it be focused on them.

Topic.Title: NBC 18% OHIO EARLY VOTE COUNT OBMA 63% ROMNEY 33%

Message.Msg: You must come from one of those back hills republican states. This is my third election as a volunteer to process absent T ballets. I am only at the starting table, I just make sure the signature and address matches the voter rolls, if they don't match I put them in a pile. The one's that don't match will end up at a table where lawyers for both sides see if the ballots I rejected get counted or not. The ballots that were not rejected move to another table where they divide the ballots Romney, Obama, they do count them, stack them before they go into a box. So they do know how many votes are for each. That is what it looks like they are doing at the second table, I can hear them call the names Romney, Obama and see the next person check and put them in piles.

Message.Title: these people know him
Message.Msg: Quotes about Romney from Republicans and Conservatives: “This is a man without a core, a man without substance, a man that will say anything to become president of the United States.” - Rudy Giuliani “I ran against him in ’07 and ’08, I’ve never seen a guy change his position so many times, so fast, on a dime,” - Rudy Giuliani “Americans are tired of politicians who change their beliefs to match public opinion polls. Mitt Romney needs to realize that when you try to stand on both sides of an issue, you stand for nothing.” - Rick Perry “They (voters) want to know what’s the truth. They’re not interested in a chameleon.” - Michelle Bachmann “The big problem many conservatives have with Mitt Romney is that he’s taken both sides of nearly every issue important to us.” - Club for Growth “Here is a guy who is the ultimate flip-flopper running for president, and he’s attacking me for not being principled? That doesn’t wash.” - Rick Santorum “Pick any other Republican in the country. He is the worst Republican in the country to put up against Barack Obama.” - Rick Santorum “Gov. Romney has claimed to have created 100,000 jobs at Bain and people are wanting to know, is there proof of that claim? And was it U.S. jobs created for United States citizens?” - Sarah Palin “If you’re not sure about whether to support Mitt Romney, whether you’re liberal, or whether you’re very conservative, you ought to be excited, because he’s been on your side at one time or another. So I’m not completely misunderstood. I’m not as excited as I am desperate.” - Louie Gohmert (Republican U.S. Rep from Texas) “We’re not going to beat Barack Obama with some guy who has Swiss bank accounts, Cayman Island accounts, owns shares of Goldman Sachs while it forecloses on Florida and is himself a stockholder in Freddie Mae and Freddie Mac while he tries to think the rest of us are too stupid to put the dots together” - Newt Gingrich “Now I have no doubt that Mitt Romney was worried about pink slips — whether he was going to have enough of them to hand out because his company Bain Capital with all the jobs that they killed, I’m sure he was worried that he’d run out of pink slips. There is something inherently wrong when getting rich off failure and sticking it to someone else is how you do your business and I happen to think that’s indefensible.” - Rick Perry (Republican Gov. of Texas) “I believe most Americans want their next President to remind them of the guy they work with, not the guy who laid them off.” - Mike Huckabee “And we thought nobody could fill John Kerry’s flip-flops! … [Romney's record was] “anything but conservative until he changed all the light bulbs in his chandelier in time to run for President.” - Mike Huckabee
